definition[0]: a hole or container that has been specially made and filled with water so that people can swim or play in it
example[0]: They have a nice pool in their backyard.
example[1]: a shallow pool suitable for children
definition[1]: a small area of still water in a hollow place
example[2]: pools of water with tiny fish in them
example[3]: Mosquitoes breed in stagnant pools of water.
definition[2]: a game in which you use a stick to hit numbered balls into holes around a table, which is often played in bars
example[4]: We went to the pub and played pool.
definition[3]: a group of people who are available to work or to do an activity when they are needed
example[5]: The region has a large and talented labour pool.
example[6]: a pool of talented applicants to choose from
definition[4]: a number of things that are shared or an amount of money that is shared by a group of people
example[7]: Both partners put money into a common pool.
definition[5]: a game in which people try to win money by guessing the result of a sports game, or the money that is collected from these people for this
definition[6]: to combine your money, ideas, skills etc with those of other people so that you can all use them
example[9]: Investors agreed to pool their resources to develop the property.
example[10]: The students worked together, pooling their knowledge.
definition[7]: an amount of money or a number of things shared by a group of people
example[11]: Both partners put money into a common pool, and both may spend this money.
definition[8]: a group of people who are available to do a particular job, if they are needed
example[12]: Taiwan offered a pool of cheap labour.
example[13]: There is a considerable pool of experience within our own organization.
definition[9]: an association of insurance companies organized to UNDERWRITE (=be responsible for) a particular risk, each member sharing any costs or losses
example[14]: the state-run pool for high-risk drivers
example[15]: Meetings enable people to pool ideas.
example[16]: More and more firms are pooling their resources and going into joint ventures.
